publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1594 Pauline McNeill: Centre for Political Song—That the Parliament congratulates Glasgow Caledonian University on launching the world’s first ever Centre for Political Song; welcomes the generous donation of former MEP, Janey Buchan, and notes that Janey and her late husband, Norman, amassed a wonderful collection of labour movement and protest music and that their lifelong enthusiasm for political song has been inspirational to many of us.
S1M-1594 Centre for Political Song (lodged on 26 January 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Karen Gillon*
S1M-1594 Centre for Political Song (lodged on 26 January 2001) Alex Neil*, Trish Godman*, Cathy Peattie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Irene Oldfather*

S1M-1594 Pauline McNeill: Centre for Political Song—That the Parliament congratulates Glasgow Caledonian University on launching the world’s first ever Centre for Political Song; welcomes the generous donation of former MEP, Janey Buchan, and notes that Janey and her late husband, Norman, amassed a wonderful collection of labour movement and protest music and that their lifelong enthusiasm for political song has been inspirational to many of us. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Karen Gillon, Alex Neil, Trish Godman, Cathy Peattie, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Jamie Stone, Irene Oldfather
S1M-1594 Centre for Political Song (lodged on 26 January 2001) Robin Harper*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1594 Centre for Political Song (lodged on 26 January 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1594 Centre for Political Song (lodged on 26 January 2001) Margaret Jamieson*
S1M-1594 Centre for Political Song (lodged on 26 January 2001) Dr Elaine Murray*

S1M-1594 Pauline McNeill: Centre for Political Song—That the Parliament congratulates Glasgow Caledonian University on launching the world’s first ever Centre for Political Song; welcomes the generous donation of former MEP, Janey Buchan, and notes that Janey and her late husband, Norman, amassed a wonderful collection of labour movement and protest music and that their lifelong enthusiasm for political song has been inspirational to many of us. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Karen Gillon, Alex Neil, Trish Godman, Cathy Peattie, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Jamie Stone, Irene Oldfather, Robin Harper, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Andrew Wilson, Mr Gil Paterson, Linda Fabiani, Margaret Jamieson, Dr Elaine Murray
S1M-1594 Centre for Political Song (lodged on 26 January 2001) Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-1594 Centre for Political Song (lodged on 26 January 2001) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-1594 Pauline McNeill: Centre for Political Song—That the Parliament congratulates Glasgow Caledonian University on launching the world’s first ever Centre for Political Song; welcomes the generous donation of former MEP, Janey Buchan, and notes that Janey and her late husband, Norman, amassed a wonderful collection of labour movement and protest music and that their lifelong enthusiasm for political song has been inspirational to many of us. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Karen Gillon, Alex Neil, Trish Godman, Cathy Peattie, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Jamie Stone, Irene Oldfather, Robin Harper, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Andrew Wilson, Mr Gil Paterson, Linda Fabiani, Margaret Jamieson, Dr Elaine Murray, Cathy Jamieson, Mr John McAllion, Maureen Macmillan*, Rhoda Grant*

S1M-1594 Pauline McNeill: Centre for Political Song—That the Parliament congratulates Glasgow Caledonian University on launching the world’s first ever Centre for Political Song; welcomes the generous donation of former MEP, Janey Buchan, and notes that Janey and her late husband, Norman, amassed a wonderful collection of labour movement and protest music and that their lifelong enthusiasm for political song has been inspirational to many of us. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Michael McMahon, Karen Gillon, Alex Neil, Trish Godman, Cathy Peattie, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Jamie Stone, Irene Oldfather, Robin Harper, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Andrew Wilson, Mr Gil Paterson, Linda Fabiani, Margaret Jamieson, Dr Elaine Murray, Cathy Jamieson, Mr John McAllion, Maureen Macmillan, Rhoda Grant, Karen Whitefield*
